item.title: What I learned from the Social Network Analysis Class
item.author: Author
item.description: Introduction This semester, I took a course titled CI 8371 - Applied Social Network Analysis in Education taught by Prof. Bodong Chen. This course introduced a novel research methodology - Social Network Analysis (SNA) including the ethics, techniques, and application in education research. SNA is powerful to unveil the invisible yet important connections between communications, concepts and many other kinds of networks. I am intrigued by the word “connection”. In my life, no matter when I was watching a movie, or brainstorming about a design work, the most amazing moment is me starting to “see” new inspirations running to my head and connecting to my system.
